title: U.S. Jobless Claims Fell Last Week to Five-Month Low
text:
By Likhitha Butchireddygari and Sarah Chaney

WASHINGTON--The number of Americans applying for first-time unemployment benefits fell last week to the lowest level since April.

--Initial jobless claims were down 15,000 to 204,000 in the week ending Sept. 7, the lowest level since April when claims hit 193,000, the Labor Department said Thursday. Economists surveyed by The Wall Street Journal expected jobless claims to fall to 215,000.

--Weekly jobless claims can be volatile. The four-week moving average decreased 4,250 to 212,500, slightly elevated compared with a year earlier.

--Continuing claims, those filed by workers unemployed for longer than a week, fell by 4,000 to 1.67 million in the week ending Aug 31.

The Labor Department report on jobless claims can be accessed at: https://www.dol.gov/ui/data.pdf.

Write to Likhitha Butchireddygari at likhitha.butchireddygari@wsj.com and Sarah Chaney at sarah.chaney@wsj.com

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

September 12, 2019 08:45 ET (12:45 GMT)
